intro: Cistus salviifolius var. grandifolius, commonly known as the large-leaved rock rose, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It features aromatic, silver-gray leaves that are lanceolate and often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it well-suited for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its nectar-rich blooms attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
